columns.text: The goal of this task is to determine de Annual percentage rate being quoted and the monthly payment for a $36$-month lease with a sales tax of $7\%$.

We have the following given information: 
<center>

|Variable|	Value|
|:--:|:--:|
|Price of the car|	$\$41,900$|
|Other costs|	$\$850$|
|Down payment|	$\$4,300$|
|Residual value|	$\$30,500$|
|Lease factor| 	$0.00195$|
|Term of the lease| 	$36$ months|
|Sales tax| 	$7\%$|
<center>Table 1. The givens.

Let's first calculate the Annual percentage rate using the formula $(2)$: $$ \begin{align*} \operatorname{APR} &= \text{Money factor}\times2400\\ &= 0.00195\times 2400\\ &= 4.68\% \end{align*} $$ ***The Annual Percentage rate quoted is $\bold{4.68\%}$***.

$$
\begin{align*}
\text{Finance fee} &= (\text{Net capitalization cost }+\text{ residual cost})\times \text{Money factor}\\[10pt] 
&= (\$41,900 + \$850 -\$4,300 + \$30,500)\times0.00195\\[10pt] 
&= \$68,950\times0.00195\\[10pt] 
&= \$134.45 
\end{align*}
$$

***The Finance fee per month is $\bold{\$134.45}$.***

$$
\begin{align*}
\text{Sales tax} &= (\text{Depreciation payment} + \text{Finance fee})\times \text{Tax rate}\\[10pt]          
&= (\$220.83 + \$134.45)\times0.07\\[10pt] 
&= \$24.87
\end{align*}
$$
***The Sales tax per month is $\bold{\$24.87}$***.

If we sum all the fees we can find the monthly payment of the car lease: $$ \begin{align*} \text{Monthly lease payment} &= \text{Depreciation fee} + \text{Financial fee}+\text{Sales tax}\\[10pt] &=\$220.83 + \$134.45 + \$24.87\\[10pt] &= \$380,15. \end{align*} $$ Monthly lease payment for a $36$-month lease if the sales tax is $7\%$ is $\$380,15$. ***Monthly lease payment for a $\bold{36}$-month lease if the sales tax is $\bold{7\%}$ is $\bold{\$380,15}$***.
